result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmond Jondale Mendoza-Blackwell

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties. Case re-scheduled for a Plea/Sentencing hearing on 01/12/2022 at 02:30 pm, Br 16.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Adjourn, filed by defense

Defendant Desmond Jondale Mendoza-Blackwell in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has discovery and an offer. Defendant recently enrolled in treatment and defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department-2/28/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department-2/28/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department-2/28/2022
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 02/28/2022

Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.

Remaining cash bail post to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Desmond Jondale Mendoza-Blackwell in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for a status conference in Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1:30p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/18/22 @ 1:30p
